title: Correct rounding direction needs to be used when accumulating pmData in memory or storage
content:
## Severity: Low Risk

## Context
- CoreStateUtils.sol#L259
- MarginViewUtils.sol#L89-L105
- PendingOIPureUtils.sol#L40
- PendingOIPureUtils.sol#L48
- PendingOIPureUtils.sol#L61
- ProcessMergeUtils.sol#L68

## Description/Recommendation
In general, when adding to `pmData`, the delta accumulated needs to be rounded up, and when subtracting from `pmData`, the delta subtracted needs to be rounded down. This would guarantee that the initial margin checks are stricter.

### Desired Rounding Direction

| Location                       | Desired Rounding Direction | Current Rounding Direction | Function                |
|--------------------------------|----------------------------|----------------------------|-------------------------|
| _squashPartial                 | up                         | down                       | _calcPMFromFill        |
| _updateOIAndPMOnSwept         | down                       | down                       | _calcPMFromFill        |
| _mergePartialFillAft          | down                       | down                       | _calcPMFromFill        |
| _updatePMOnAdd                | up                         | down                       | _calcPMFromTick        |
| _updatePMOnRemove             | down                       | down                       | _calcPMFromTick        |

## Responses
- **Pendle Finance**: Acknowledged. Won't fix as we will scale all to 1e18 to avoid having to be too strict with rounding.
- **Spearbit**: Acknowledged.
